servers.name: microsoft/fabric-rti-mcp
servers.description: Query Eventhouse/ADX with KQL and manage Eventstreams.

kusto_service_uri.description: Default Kusto cluster URI (e.g., https://help.kusto.windows.net/ or your cluster).

kusto_default_db.description: Default database name for Kusto queries (e.g., Samples).

az_openai_embedding_endpoint.description: Azure OpenAI embeddings endpoint for shots/semantic search (format: https://<resource>.openai.azure.com/openai/deployments/<name>/embeddings?api-version=<version>;impersonate).

kusto_known_services_json.description: JSON array of preconfigured Kusto services (e.g., [{"service_uri":"https://cluster.kusto.windows.net","default_database":"DB"}]).

kusto_eager_connect.description: Whether to eagerly connect to the default service on startup (true/false).

kusto_allow_unknown_services.description: Allow connections to services not listed in KUSTO_KNOWN_SERVICES (true/false).

fabric_api_base.description: Base URL for Fabric APIs (default https://api.fabric.microsoft.com/v1).

servers.name: hashicorp/terraform-mcp-server
servers.description: Seamlessly integrate with Terraform ecosystem, enabling advanced automation and interaction capabilities for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) development powered by Terraform

servers.name: figma/dev-mode-mcp-server
servers.description: Expose design context to MCP clients.

servers.name: azure/aks-mcp
servers.description: Interact with Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) from MCP clients.

aks_mcp_binary.description: Absolute path to the downloaded 'aks-mcp' binary.

access_level.description: readonly | readwrite | admin (defaults to readonly if omitted).

allow_namespaces.description: Comma-separated list of allowed namespaces (empty means all).

azure_client_id.description: Service principal or managed identity client ID.

azure_managed_identity.description: Set to 'system' to use system-assigned MI.

servers.name: oraios/serena
servers.description: Semantic code retrieval & editing tools for coding agents.

serena_project_abs_path.description: Absolute path to the project root Serena should index.

servers.name: stripe/agent-toolkit
servers.description: Interact with Stripe API

servers.name: makenotion/notion-mcp-server
servers.description: Official MCP server for Notion API

servers.name: atlassian/atlassian-mcp-server
servers.description: Remote MCP Server that securely connects Jira and Confluence with your LLM, IDE, or agent platform of choice.

servers.name: neondatabase/mcp-server-neon
servers.description: MCP server for interacting with Neon Management API and databases

servers.name: mongodb-js/mongodb-mcp-server
servers.description: A Model Context Protocol server to connect to MongoDB databases and MongoDB Atlas Clusters.

mongo_port.description: MongoDB port (e.g., 27017). For SRV URIs, omit and use the +srv scheme.

servers.name: pydantic/logfire-mcp
servers.description: Provides access to OpenTelemetry traces and metrics through Logfire.

logfire_base_url.description: Self-hosted Logfire base URL (omit for cloud)

servers.name: chroma-core/chroma-mcp
servers.description: Provides data retrieval capabilities powered by Chroma, enabling AI models to create collections over generated data and user inputs, and retrieve that data using vector search, full text search, metadata filtering, and more.

chroma_client_type.description: Client type: ephemeral (default), persistent, cloud, or http.

chroma_custom_auth.description: Custom auth credentials for self-hosted Chroma.

servers.name: jfrog/jfrog-mcp-server
servers.description: JFrog MCP Server: providing your agents with direct access to JFrog Platform services.

servers.name: firecrawl/firecrawl-mcp-server
servers.description: Extract web data with Firecrawl

servers.name: dynatrace-oss/dynatrace-mcp
servers.description: Manage and interact with the Dynatrace Platform for real-time observability and monitoring.

dt_environment.description: Dynatrace Platform URL (e.g., https://abc12345.apps.dynatrace.com â€” not classic live.dynatrace.com).

servers.name: microsoft/azure-devops-mcp
servers.description: Interact with Azure DevOps services like repositories, work items, builds, releases, test plans, and code search.

ado_domain.description: Repeat to enable specific domains: core, work, work-items, search, test-plans, repositories, wiki, pipelines, advanced-security.

servers.name: azure-ai-foundry/mcp-foundry
servers.description: An experimental MCP server implementation for Azure AI Foundry that exposes unified tools for models, knowledge, evaluation and deployment.

env_file_path.description: Path to a .env file to load (e.g., ${workspaceFolder}/.env).

github_token.description: Optional: GitHub token for testing models for free with rate limits.

ai_search_endpoint.description: Your Azure AI Search endpoint (https://<service>.search.windows.net/). Required for knowledge tools.

eval_data_dir.description: Path to JSONL datasets for evaluation tools.

az_openai_api_key.description: API key for the above endpoint (optional).

az_openai_deployment.description: Deployment name (e.g., gpt-4o) used by evaluators (optional).

ai_project_endpoint.description: Azure AI Project endpoint for agent tools (optional).

servers.name: microsoft/clarity-mcp-server
servers.description: Fetch Clarity analytics via MCP clients.

clarity_api_token.description: Microsoft Clarity Data Export API token (generate in Clarity: Settings â†’ Data Export).

servers.name: zapier/zapier-mcp
servers.description: Zapier MCP is a remote MCP server that gives your AI direct access to 8,000+ apps and 30,000+ actionsâ€”no complex API integrations required.

servers.name: sunriseapps/imagesorcery-mcp
servers.description: Local image processing with computer vision capabilities including object detection, OCR, image editing, and transformations.

imagesorcery_binary.description: Path to the 'imagesorcery-mcp' executable (or just 'imagesorcery-mcp' if itâ€™s in PATH). On Windows: imagesorcery-mcp.exe

servers.name: antfu/nuxt-mcp
servers.description: MCP server helping models understand your Vite/Nuxt app.

servers.name: coplaydev/unity-mcp
servers.description: Control the Unity Editor from MCP clients via a Unity bridge + local Python server.

unity_mcp_server_src.description: Absolute path to the Unity MCP Server 'src' folder installed by the Unity package (e.g., macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/UnityMCP/UnityMcpServer/src; Windows: %USERPROFILE%/AppData/Local/UnityMCP/UnityMcpServer/src; Linux: ~/.local/share/UnityMCP/UnityMcpServer/src).

servers.name: upstash/context7
servers.description: Get up-to-date, version-specific documentation and code examples from any library or framework.

context7_api_key.description: Context7 API key (optional; increases rate limits). Get one at https://context7.com/dashboard

servers.name: microsoft/markitdown
servers.description: Convert various file formats (PDF, Word, Excel, images, audio) to Markdown.

servers.name: getsentry/sentry-mcp
servers.description: Retrieve and analyze application errors and performance issues from Sentry projects.

servers.name: microsoft/playwright-mcp
servers.description: Automate web browsers using accessibility trees for testing and data extraction.

servers.name: microsoftdocs/mcp
servers.description: Enables clients like GitHub Copilot and other AI agents to bring trusted and up-to-date information directly from Microsoft's official documentation.

servers.name: webflow/mcp-server
servers.description: Enable AI agents to interact with Webflow APIs.

servers.name: mondaycom/mcp
servers.description: Enable AI agents to work reliably - giving them secure access to structured data, tools to take action, and the context needed to make smart decisions.

monday_api_token.description: Your monday.com API token (can also be passed with -t/--token).

servers.name: codacy/codacy-mcp-server
servers.description: MCP Server for the Codacy API, enabling access to repositories, files, quality, coverage, security and more.

codacy_account_token.description: Your Codacy Account API token (from app.codacy.com â†’ Account). Required.

codacy_cli_version.description: Optional: pin Codacy CLI version used by local analysis (e.g., 2.3.1).
